Reviews.Title: Love it, so far... Windows 8 takes getting used to
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: I just received this today so I may post a follow up review later.My first impression was that it was huge.  It's thicker and heavier than I expected but for the price point it's to be expected.  I don't plan to travel too often with it so it's not a huge concern to me.  Setup with windows 8 is unbelievably simple and makes it quick to get up and running.  I'm not a fan of the new Metro start screen.  I tried to customize it but it still just took up way too much space for my liking.  So I ended up downloading a free app, called classic shell that brought back the start menu functionality for me.  I think the laptop (which is what we are actually reviewing here - not windows 8) is quite peppy and the specs are more than adequate for any average user.  If you primarily use your computer for homework, email, web surfing, etc this will be great.  If you're a heavy gamer you probably want something else.

Reviews.Title: Dell inspiron with windows 8
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: I am using this new laptop every day and is really amazing, they new operative system windows 8 create the perfect enviroment to work without any problem

Reviews.Title: MY DELL
Reviews.Author: Arlene "Arlene"
Reviews.Content: A VERY NICE LAPTOP AND VERY FAST.  IT IS WELL WORK THE MONEY I PAID.  I AM VERY PLEASED WITH MY PURCHASE

Reviews.Title: What a nightmare!
Reviews.Author: Shanon
Reviews.Content: This it is my second, after I returned the first one with the same issue. The size, weight and Windows 8 Operating System are fine. However, they have a defect in the sensitivity of the mouse. It causes the curser to skip all over the place. You will be typing an email and it will suddenly skip to the middle of another sentence or paragraph or even better delete the document or email all together. It is all random and at first I thought it was me, then maybe just a weird defect. I sent the brand new Laptop back to Amazon, who promptly sent me another new one. The same thing started again after about 2 weeks. I contacted Dell support, in India. After about 30 minutes on the phone and remote access to remedy the issue they told me that I would need to purchase a $289 "Software Warranty" to correct the problem. I was told I must have downloaded something that corrupted the Mouse File. Seriously, are you kidding! On both brand new laptops? I had not even put my personal documents on the system yet. And certainly did not download anything. All I had done was surf the net on some basic websites like Amazon and Target!I have returned the second one and was refunded my money. I ordered a Samsung Chromebook, $150 dollars cheaper and looks like it is going to be a much better laptop. Do not purchase this item. I have no idea how it got good reviews? If it had not happened with two different new laptops I could have understood but this is definitely a defect in the computer.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Dome
Reviews.Content: I gave it 5 stars because I really love it! This laptop is really fast and it absolutely overcame my expectations. The price is an opportunity and if you need a laptop for typical uses (word, web surfing, etc) I really would recommend this one. The only bad thing that I am going to say is that Windows 8 takes some time to get use to, I don't believe that it is horrible but it is a big change... But overall I am pretty happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Really 5 stars for price meets quality
Reviews.Author: the J man
Reviews.Content: I will try to make this short and sweet.  All drivers etc loaded right up in about 15-20 minutes.  Disc drive played anything I put in it strait off. Beautiful large screen.  This is a good laptop for home media purposes.  3-4 star keyboard.  Great track pad with scroll and pinch.  Track buttons are a little soft, but not much of a setback, especially if you're a tapper.  Nice material/finish/construction for the price. I think it has a solid feel to it.  Very fast start up and shutdown (surprised me).  Great processing speed.  I've used it for: browsing, streaming, hulu, youtube and most importantly the Photoshop cs6 cloud.  Photoshop runs just fine on this inspiron, and only bogged up when I had 4 or 5 images open at once.So strengths are: Screen.  Processing.  Price.  And audio: really good sound, even just through the onboard speakers.Only weakness really is that it is a bit big/bulky for a laptop.  So I guess that's the trade off for a low priced, good running machine.Ps - windows 8 isn't so bad.  kinda fun.  Just takes a day or three and you have it figured out.

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: AlessandraCo "Alessandra"
Reviews.Content: First impressions:Feels lighter than I expected. I'd be okay with it having been slightly heavier if it would have made it feel like a higher quality machine; feels UBER plasticky.One thing I have an issue with--and I will bring this up to Amazon--is that the ad says it's a 2.6 processor, yet the box says 2.2. That's extremely frustrating considering the processor is a primary component I was strongly considering in whatever pc purchase I made.Keyboard is responsive with hand placement being pretty much where I like it. The ctrl key isn't where I'm used to but, no big deal. As a first time Windows 8 user, so far so good. I actually like it.I do like the screen size; can't go wrong with the large display. Perhaps it just seems large to me since my Mac Air is 13 inches.Overall I understand that we spent $400-ish, not $800+, for this computer so i'm fairly satisfied. I don't know how Amazon will resolve the mistake they made by advertising this machine with the incorrect processor power. Other than that, I think i'll enjoy this computerUPDATE: Amazon was more than willing to exchange the pc for me. Overall this purchase is definitely a worthwhile one.

Reviews.Title: More than disappointing
Reviews.Author: APQQH
Reviews.Content: For the first month I had the computer it seemed to work fine. I did not like Windows 8. Instead of being easier to use, it was confusing. Any program, now called app. required going into several screens instead of the single start menu. There is no area, button, etc. to close these apps. The BIGGEST problem I had was at week five, The computer died. I was able to get into the bios and got several error messages. Called Dell, only to be told the motherboard and the hard drive were dead and would have to be replaced.The computer I had before the Dell, an HP, it's motherboard died after 6 months. I had to send it to HP to get it fixed. Who ever fixed it hacked my computer and I spent almost a year getting that straightened out. Two years after it was "fixed" it went completely haywire and died for good. My warranty had run out. It would cost less to buy a new computer than get it fixed yet again. Basically the $1200 I paid for it was a total waste. What happened to QUALITY products? Where is the pride in making a solid, well working computer?I teach how to use computers, how to upgrade computers, and I have worked as a computer tech to help others with computer problems and questions. Until three years ago I have never seen such sloppy, untrained "professions" who build computers and create software. In my opinion to other computer buyers, don't spend more than $500 for any computer because chances are good there will be major problems with it.

Reviews.Title: My personal Laptop
Reviews.Author: Betty Shaw
Reviews.Content: This has run without a glitch from the start. If you can find a Dell at a good price (like here) it will be a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: H J K
Reviews.Content: After only  15 months of actually light usage the hard drive is faulty.  I never felt it was user friendly from the start (Windows 8/non-touch screen) but thought I would learn in time.  That didn't happen and the early demise is a real disappointment.  I am a light user and really feel this final issue was not my doing.  The Dell support I contacted today was a horrendous 1 1/2 hour phone call with many transfers and the repitition of most information.  Microsoft support was a similar experience.  I will have this computer repaired  locally, not going to send it in and save my $ for a product not produced by either Dell or Microsoft.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Dulce
Reviews.Content: It came early, so i was surprised....but the PC never turned on. Will be returning it. I regret purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: Dell Inspiron
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: The computer works ok but the usb ports are in the wrong place at the side and front,when you have a wireless mouse and printer the cord and stick are always in the way

Reviews.Title: Good laptop at a great price
Reviews.Author: Alfonso12
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop to replace my old Dell Inspiron, which was having problems after a few years.  So far, this one has been great.  The processor is plenty fast for everyday computing, web browsing, watching videos, etc.  The keyboard is big and easy to type on, and the screen is very clear.  I don't know how it would be for gaming and things like that, but considering the processor speed, memory size, etc., it was the best deal I found.The main drawback was that it came with Windows 8, which does not come with a "Start" button and instead has a separate start page with "apps".  But I downloaded (actually purchased for $3) a program that installs a start button that looks and acts pretty much exactly like the old one, and bypasses the start menu when I start the computer.  So now it basically functions like previous Windows versions, which is great.  So overall I am very happy with the computer so far.

Reviews.Title: rotten deal
Reviews.Author: Deborah M. Fichtner
Reviews.Content: do not like windows 8 and I cannot get movies to play on my laptop.  do I need to purchase some other software to make it work. ig I do what a rip off?????

Reviews.Title: Dell is the Best
Reviews.Author: Barbara Kone
Reviews.Content: I have a number of Dell computer products. They are the best! You can feel comfortable buying products made by dell.

Reviews.Title: don't like windows 8
Reviews.Author: peggy a. Lenox
Reviews.Content: I love it and it's versatility. BUT I hate windows 8.User unfriendly.Can't switch between windows.Love Dell, but not "8".After 3 months, still doing tutorials.

Reviews.Title: The best
Reviews.Author: judith
Reviews.Content: I loved it, i think that this laptop is one of the best and an accesible price, i recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Expected alot more.
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop mainly for email, FB and Farmville. Have had issues with FV not loading etc... "computer" seems to think I need better Flash Player, but it has the best. And the menu configurations with Windows 8 make it impossible for me to figure out how to fix this problem. After 5 mths, the screen has gone black... I called Dell (in India) and was ABSOLUTLEY NOT SATISFIED with the techies. They were trying to sell me the $259/yr software contract before even determining if it was software or not. Once I got them to check the hardware and it was ok, I was transferred and went thru the sales pitch again (once I could hear and understand the man- trust me I wanted their help, so I was being polite!) He then offered to fix it for $129 without knowing what was wrong. I WOULD NEVER HAVE BOUGHT THIS IF I HAD KNOWN IT WOULD COST MORE THAN 1/2 THE PURCHASE PRICE TO PROTECT IT... and that's only per year... I will be chatting w/ Amazon-then GeekSquad!

Reviews.Title: Questionable quality
Reviews.Author: Christopher L Stransky
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son for his homework.  It worked right out of the box and from a software point there has been no issues.  The keyboard however seems a little cheaply made and at least one of the keys was sticking after about a month of use.

Reviews.Title: Very , very good!!!!
Reviews.Author: Sandra C. Florencio
Reviews.Content: I loved this laptop, I'm learning to deal with Windows 8, but already I'm getting used to it. Really good!!

Reviews.Title: This laptop serves my needs very much...
Reviews.Author: JUNE KLABUNDE
Reviews.Content: We needed something convenient to take along on trips so decided on a laptop instead of using an ipad...thinking that the print would be bigger and the page more spacious. So that is what we found to be the case.

Reviews.Title: No Microsoft included
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Windows 8  is obviously new and certainly is not intuitive to use. So far I have no positive reasons for going from 7 to 8! I was very surprised that this computer  did not include Microsoft Word and Excel in some form so if you want that get another computer that includes it or buy new software. I could not see anyway to move my old Windows Office 2003 to this new computer

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 is horrible!!!
Reviews.Author: Dawn C Arquette
Reviews.Content: Windows 8; not user friendly stick with Windows 7. The interface is non-intuitive and by far the worst I've ever seen.
